Name: Motherboard
Description: A motherboard connects all components of a computer, allowing communication between CPU, RAM, and peripherals.

Name: Graphics Card
Description: A graphics card processes images and video, enhancing gaming, design, and rendering performance.

Name: RAM
Description: Random Access Memory (RAM) temporarily stores data for quick access by the CPU, improving multitasking and speed.

Name: Processor
Description: A CPU executes instructions, processing data and running applications within a computer system.

Name: Computer Case
Description: A protective enclosure housing computer components, providing airflow and organization.

Name: Power Supply
Description: Converts electricity from an outlet into usable power for a computer's components.

Name: Laptops
Description: Portable computers with built-in screens, keyboards, and batteries for on-the-go use.

Name: Fans
Description: Cooling fans help regulate temperature inside a computer, preventing overheating.

Name: External Hard
Description: A storage device connected via USB, used for backups and extra file storage.

Name: Internal Hard
Description: A storage drive inside a computer, used to store the operating system, files, and applications.

Name: Memory Card
Description: A small storage device used in cameras, phones, and computers for data transfer and backup.

Name: Keyboard
Description: An input device with keys for typing and controlling a computer.

Name: Laptop Backpacks
Description: Backpacks designed with compartments to safely carry laptops and accessories.

Name: Mouse
Description: A pointing device used to control a cursor on a computer screen.

Name: Speaker
Description: A device that outputs audio, used for music, calls, and media playback.

Name: Headphones
Description: Wearable speakers that provide private audio for music, gaming, or calls.

Name: Microphones
Description: A device that captures sound for recording, communication, and broadcasting.
